item.title: Need help with portals
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

Ok

What I mean is, first check to see if you have this in your clickingMost.java

Search:

public void clicking(int a){

Have this after it, if it’s not there already:

[code=java]client c = (client) server.playerHandler.players[a];
if (c.playerRights > 2){
System.out.println("Clicked button: " + c.actionButtonId + “”);

		c.println("ID " + c.actionButtonId);

}[/code]

Now when you click on buttons (anything in the gameframe or interfaces) it will show in your CMD

Those numbers are the case ID’s you need to use, yours will be different because I just clicked on some random stuff to show this to you

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with portals
item.dc:creator: @rova1 rova1
item.description:
@rova1 wrote:

OK, click on the object, then click on each one of those options. Now if you look at the CMD it should print the button ID of each option. In the following examples, #### represents your button IDs

Open clickingMost.java and add this anywhere inside the switch statement:

  1. Danger
    I don’t know what you want this to do, don’t think it needs to be a choice really…

  2. Info

case ####: if (c.teleEffect == 3) { c.sendQuest("Info", 8144); // guide c.clearQuestInterface(); c.sendQuest("Teleport to something", 8145); c.sendQuest("text", 8146); c.sendQuest("text2", 8147); c.sendQuest("text3", 8148); c.sendQuest("text4",8150); c.sendQuestSomething(8143); c.showInterface(8134); c.flushOutStream(); } break;

  1. yes

case ####: if (c.teleEffect == 3) { c.triggerTele(xxxx, yyyy, h); } break;
Replace:
xxxx - x co-ordinate of tele
yyyy - y co-ordinate of tele
h - height of tele (ground = 0)

  1. No

case ####: if (c.teleEffect == 3) { c.closeInterface(); } break;

Read full topic
